intro: Monotagma contrariosum, commonly known as the opposite-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive opposite leaf arrangement. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a slightly hairy texture. Monotagma contrariosum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
